method.name: GET
method.doc: The Yahoo Traffic Service method, trafficData, provides parameters that support getting traffic information for a location based on street name, city, state, zip code, or a combination of latitude and longitude. You can also specify whether to include a map image, and you can provide a search radius in miles. For API documentation see: http://developer.yahoo.com/traffic/rest/V1/index.html

param.name: appid
param.doc: The application ID. for more information, see http://developer.yahoo.com/faq/index.html#appid .

param.name: street
param.doc: Optional. Street name, with or without the house number.

param.name: state
param.doc: Optional. The state name for a United States location You can spell out the full state name or you can use the two-letter abbreviation. For a list of abbreviations, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State_codes .

param.name: zip
param.doc: Optional. The five-digit zip code, or the five-digit code plus four-digit extension. If the city and state are specified and they don't match the zip code, only the zip code is used.

param.name: location
param.doc: Optional. A free-form field in which you can enter the following combinations of values: [city, state], [city, state, zip], [zip], [street, city, state], [street, city, state, zip], [street, zip]. If this parameter is specified, it takes priority over the corresponding parameters, and the city, state, and zip parameters are ignored.

param.name: latitude
param.doc: Optional. The latitude of the starting location, range -90 to 90.

param.name: longitude
param.doc: Optional. The longitude of the starting location, range -180 to 180. If both latitude and longitude are specified, they take priority and all other location data is ignored. If only one of latitude or longitude is specified, both will be ignored.

param.name: severity
param.doc: Optional. The minimum severity level to return, from 1, least severe, to 5, most severe. Defaults to 1.

param.name: zoom
param.doc: Optional. The zoom level for the data, from 1, street level, to 12, country level. Defaults to 6. If a radius is specified, this parameter is ignored.s

param.name: radius
param.doc: Optional. A distance in miles from the specified location. The default radius varies according to the location given and the zoom level. If a zoom is specified, this parameter is ignored and the default radius is used.

param.name: include_map
param.doc: Optional. Specifies whether to return a URL of a map image for the location of each reported incident. Default value is 0, no map image. If you specify 1, the URL of a map image is returned.

param.name: image_type
param.doc: Optional. The image format for the map if a map is requested. Default value is png. You can also specify gif.

param.name: image_height
param.doc: Optional. If a map is requested, specifies the height in pixels, an integer from 10 to 2000. Default height is 500.

param.name: image_width
param.doc: Optional. If a map is requested, specifies the height in pixels, an integer from 10 to 2000. Default width is 620.

param.name: output
param.doc: Optional. The format for the output. Defaults to xml as described under Response Elements at http://developer.yahoo.com/traffic/rest/V1/index.html . If php is requested, the results are returned in Serialized PHP format as described at http://developer.yahoo.com/common/phpserial.html .
